overview: CodeForge uses a modular AI service architecture that integrates OpenAI's GPT models across all features. Each designer has specialized prompts and validation logic to ensure high-quality generated code.

coreServices.description: Central AI service orchestrating OpenAI API calls
features: Model generation with Prisma schema validation
Component generation with Material UI integration
Theme generation with color theory and accessibility
Test generation for Playwright, Storybook, and unit tests

coreServices.description: Error detection and automated repair system
Code generation utilities for project export

capabilities: Generate realistic field names and structures
Create test steps from user flows
Configure args based on prop types
Cover edge cases and error scenarios

promptEngineering.title: Context Preservation
promptEngineering.description: All AI prompts include relevant project context such as existing models, components, and theme configurations to ensure generated code integrates seamlessly.

promptEngineering.title: Format Specification
promptEngineering.description: Prompts specify exact output formats (JSON, TypeScript, Python) with strict schemas to ensure parseable and valid responses.

promptEngineering.title: Best Practices Enforcement
promptEngineering.description: Generated code follows Next.js, React, and Flask best practices through detailed prompt instructions and post-processing validation.

promptEngineering.title: Error Handling
promptEngineering.description: Fallback mechanisms and retry logic ensure graceful degradation when AI services are unavailable or responses are malformed.
